name: Set Dosa
history: Set Dosa is a popular breakfast dish from Karnataka, India. It's known for its soft, fluffy texture and is typically served in sets of three, hence the name 'Set Dosa'.
description: Set Dosa is a type of soft, thick, and spongy pancake made from a fermented batter of rice and lentils. They are smaller in size compared to regular dosas and are served in sets with chutney and sambar.

equipment.name: ladle
equipment.description: Used for pouring the batter onto the skillet.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: Soak the parboiled rice, raw rice, urad dal, poha, and fenugreek seeds in water for 4-6 hours. Drain and grind them into a smooth batter, adding water as needed. Add sugar and salt to the batter and allow it to ferment overnight.

instructions.title: Cook the Dosas
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick skillet or tawa. Grease lightly with oil. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it slightly. Cook until the dosa is fluffy and holes appear on the surface. Flip and cook the other side if desired.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Set Dosas hot with coconut chutney, sambar, or any side dish of your choice.

tips: Ensure the batter is fermented well for the best texture.
Cook on a medium flame for even browning and cooking.
variations: Try adding grated vegetables or spices to the batter for different flavors.
Experiment with different types of lentils for subtle variations in taste.

storage.shelfLife: Dosa batter can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Reheat dosas on a skillet for best texture.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat dosas on a skillet until warm.
presentationTips: Serve on a plate with a side of colorful chutneys and garnish with fresh herbs.
